title: Associate Professor

biography: Matthew Caesar is an associate professor of computer science at the University of Illinois. His research focuses on improving the robustness of computer systems and networks through principles of softwarization and programmability. He is also passionate about the Internet of Things (IoT) and has developed a series of graduate-level courses on the subject, including a hands-on Coursera specialization. Recently, he has been working on a project to improve internet connectivity during disaster response using drones.
researchStatement: My research focuses on improving the robustness of computer systems and networks through principles of softwarization and programmability, enabling the use of techniques from the field of software engineering and AI to build highly functional and reliable systems. I am currently working on a project to develop a drone-based system for providing internet connectivity during disaster response. This project involves the use of artificial intelligence and machine learning to predict where internet connectivity is needed and to deploy drones to provide coverage. The goal of this project is to provide vital internet connectivity to disaster-stricken areas, enabling emergency responders to communicate and coordinate their efforts more effectively.
